intro: Vangueria tetraphylla, commonly known as the four-leafed vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Vangueria tetraphylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
